page.title: 09PRUDHOE LIBRARY
page.content: The new library in Front Street was opened to the public on December 14th, 1984. The cost was Â£248,000. The head librarian organises competitions, and sees that all of the books are in the correct order, helped by 2 full time and 3 part time assistants. The library is also used by the Citizens Advice Bureau, The Local History Society and a slimming club. The library now lends out records and the more popular cassettes. A micro-computer is also available for library use only. Last year 425565 adult books were borrowed and 53002 childrens books were borrowed. Each year 5640 are removed from the shelves in order to make room for new ones.
